concise_definition: v. 强加, 强制推行, 征收（税等）

definitions.explanation_en: To force or establish something, especially a rule, tax, or restriction, on someone or something without their consent or against their will.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在未经同意或违背意愿的情况下，强制推行某项规则、税收或限制。
definitions.example_en: The government imposed new sanctions on the country's exports.
definitions.example_cn: 政府对该国的出口实施了新的制裁。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause someone to accept or endure something unwanted or burdensome, often through authority or power.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指利用权威或权力，使他人不得不接受或承受某种不受欢迎或繁重的事物。
definitions.example_en: Parents sometimes impose their own beliefs on their children.
definitions.example_cn: 父母有时会将自己的信念强加给孩子。

definitions.explanation_en: To levy or collect a tax, fee, or fine officially, especially by legal authority.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指依法正式征收税款、费用或罚款。
definitions.example_en: A 10% surcharge was imposed on all international transactions.
definitions.example_cn: 所有国际交易被征收了10%的附加费。

comparison.analysis: “Enforced”（强制执行）强调通过法律、规则或权力确保某项规定被遵守，侧重于“执行”过程；而 “imposed” 更侧重于“强加”这一行为本身，即决定并施加某项要求，不一定涉及后续的执行。
“Compelled”（被迫）强调因压力、义务或外界力量而不得不做某事，常带有心理或道德上的被迫感；而 “imposed” 更强调施加方的主动性和权威性，对象往往是被动接受者，不一定涉及内在动机。
“Levied”（征收）特指对税收、费用或罚款的正式收取，语义范围比 “imposed” 更窄，仅用于财政或经济领域；而 “imposed” 可用于规则、限制、负担等多种情境，适用范围更广。
